output.conclusion: Congratulations! You've completed the introductory game development course. You now have a foundation to build upon and create your own amazing games. Keep practicing and exploring!
output.introduction: Welcome to the exciting world of game development! This course is designed for beginners with no prior experience. We'll cover the fundamental concepts and tools you need to start creating your own games.

chapters.description: Defining the core elements of a game: objectives, rules, interaction, and fun.
Exploring different game genres like platformers, puzzles, RPGs, and simulations.
Overview of the stages involved in creating a game: idea, design, development, testing, and release.
Introduction to popular game engines like Unity, Godot, and GameMaker Studio 2.
Navigating the basic layout and tools of your chosen game engine.
Setting up a new game project and understanding the project structure.

modules.moduleTitle: Getting Started with a Game Engine

chapters.description: Creating and placing objects in your game world (e.g., characters, platforms, enemies).
Understanding how to manipulate objects in 3D space.
Using images to represent game objects.

modules.moduleTitle: Game Objects and the Game World

chapters.description: A simple explanation of programming concepts.
An introduction to scripting languages used in game development.
Learning the basic syntax and how to use variables in your chosen scripting language.
Writing code to control the movement of game objects.
Responding to keyboard, mouse, and touch input.
Detecting when game objects collide with each other.
Importing and playing sound effects in your game.
Adding background music to enhance the game's atmosphere.
Creating a playable version of your game for different platforms.
